page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: INHERITANCE WAS THE SOLE FACTOR IN THE TRANSFER OF HORSFORD MANOR FROM THE TIME OF THE CONQUEROR UNTIL IT WAS SOLD BY SIR RICHARD BARRETT LENNARD IN 1974. THE NAME PROBABLY COMES FROM THE POSITION AT THE LEAST MARSHY CROSSING PLACE OF THE RIVER HOR. THE FLAGCUTTERS PUB, DATED 1847 REFERS TO THE LOCAL CUSTOM OF CUTTING PEAT FOR FUEL FROM THE SURROUNDING HEATH. UNTIL THE EARLY 19TH CENTURY WEAVING WAS CARRIED ON IN THE VILLAGE HOMES, AN OFFSHOOT OF THE NORWICH CLOTH TRADE. A TOWER WINDMILL, NOW DERELICT, THE COACHBUILDERS WORKSHOP, THE SMITHY AND THREE PUBS SHOW THIS WAS ONCE A SELF CONTAINED VILLAGE RATHER THAN A COMMUTER DORMITORY FOR NORWICH. CHURCH FARM, FELTHORPE IS NOTEABLE FOR BEING THE CHILDHOOD HOME OF ANNA SEWELL'S MOTHER.A SMALL ZOO WAS KEPT BY MR. ANNERSON IN THE EARLY 20TH CENTURY.
